N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 50.70 - Mutual trust investment company to be audited annually

State Regulations
A mutual trust investment company shall, at least once
during each 12-month period, cause an audit to be made by auditors responsible
only to its board of directors. The report of such audit shall include a list
of the investments owned by the mutual trust investment company at the time of
the audit, which shall show the valuation placed on each item on such list by
the mutual trust investment company as of the date of the audit, a statement of
purchases, sales and any other investment changes and of income and
disbursements since the last audit, and appropriate comments as to any
investments in default as to payment of principal or
interest. Notes
